__e: I realize you being with me is not some kind of accident.
Wouldn't you say this is just a little bit more than a coincidence?
Well, I can't believe I'm saying this, but what if it is a coincidence?
It can't just be a coincidence that she showed up so soon after...
I mean, maybe you seeing him now, that could just be a big coincidence.
Oh, it can't be a coincidence that he's here.
Maybe, but there are too many to be just coincidental.
So... So I'm pretty sure there's no way that could just be a coincidence.
Then that is not good for us. This can also be just a coincidence, And thus is even not the end of everything.
You never lost your interest in poor little Penelope, did you?
You think it's an accident her ending up with you?
You don't really think it was a coincidence that I happened to be away these past two weeks, do you?
I don't believe it was a fluke that I saw you first.
For ever and always, Mr Merrick, I shall remember you for this.
- It's been so long, it's bizarre luck you...
You think it's an accident her ending up with you?
You're saying it's not a coincidence this woman comes forward now.
And this is just a coincidence, is it?
Being here... this is no accident, is it?
Is this coincidence, or are you back on the case?
Oh, of course, you'd like to leave it to chance...
And, sir, I'd like to say I have left nothing to chance.
...I don't think any of this should be left to chance.
Well, I wouldn't think it was a coincidence either.
She thinks something else happened, like maybe it wasn't an accident.
I didn't. You were just in the right place at the right time?
